subject: Real Estate
title: The Birth of the Suburb
description: A quick win: understand The Birth of the Suburb.

hook.text: In the 1840s, railroads let London workers live miles from their jobs for the first time.

buildup.text: Developers bought cheap farmland along new rail lines and built rows of affordable houses.

discovery.text: The suburb was born â€” not from urban planning, but from real estate speculation along train tracks.

twist.text: Wealthier families moved out first, leaving crowded city centers to the working poor.

climax.text: The pattern repeated in every industrial city: transport tech drives land value outward.

punchline.text: Suburbs exist because someone built a train.

quiz.question: What technology enabled the creation of the first suburbs?
